title: Nursing Assistant Interview

title: Supply Chain Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview -that was sent over email very basic, general questions asked. No technical questions. The interviewer seemed unsure of what to ask and how to lead the interview. Little emotion shown.

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI)
Interview Descriptions: great process loved linda she was so nice her office was nice she seem to care about her unit. All her questions were great ones I understand everything she explained to me about the unit.
Interview Questions: Why do i want to change jobs?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Dearborn, MI) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Dearborn EC kept me waiting over 1.5 hours  past the pre scheduled time in the ED lobby with no updates. I should have walked out.  They were incredibly rude.  I think they wanted me to leave because the interview only lasted fifteen minutes.
Interview Questions: What would your last boss say about you if we were to call them

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Very welcoming and easy interview. Must have good customer service skills and work well with people. The questions that are asked are very basic questions about experience and how you interact with people in certain situations
Interview Questions: Experience About yourself People skills questions

title: Technical Lead Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: My interview was online. They were fairly good at communicating and effectively answered all questions I had about the position. I didn't find the process particularly strenuous or difficult. They were reasonable.
Interview Questions: They asked me for my previous credentials.

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy, 3 interviews before offer was made. Was able to tour two sites as well to see the day to day practice. No difficulties with the recruiter who was available for all of my questions and answered promptly
Interview Questions: Where I saw myself in 5 years

title: ICU Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: It was just like other interview, nothing special and not hard. You do pre screening with the recruiter first then based on your questions you move on to unit manager.
Interview Questions: What do you think about being charge or preceptor?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Never heard back one way or another. If didn't get the position, would like to know so I can move on/ keep looking. Disappointing as this was my preferred position/ company.
Interview Questions: typical questions for an interview

title: Office Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was pretty standard, Started with a phone screen, then an in person interview. About a week after interview, I received a call about offer. The whole process took about a month
Interview Questions: what is your prior experience

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great, easy, smooth, and friendly! The manager, assistant manager, and unit educator interviewed me together in a conference room. Although the hospital was very difficult to navigate and I got lost - arrive early! The hospital has a golf course behind it which I loved to watch through the window.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you disagreed with management?

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received a text from a Beaumont recruiter who set up the interview. The next day I had the phone interview with the nursing manager of the unit. Basic questions and laid-back experience. The application process is lengthy though!
Interview Questions: Tell me about how you would handle a frustrated or disgruntled patient/family member.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Detroit, MI) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The have you do a professionalism senerio based questionnaire over the phone. And boom you get selected based on your good sameritain answer. Then they have you type short answers to moral questions as well.
Interview Questions: What did you do when you had conflict in the past? How will you learn the Beaumont culture when you’re at work? If staff asks you to float what will you tell them?

title: ICU Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, they ask the normal questions. You can shadow for a couple hours. Definitely want to fit in with the staff, but they seem to hire everyone including new grads

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Very engaging. Nurse floor manager made the interview feel very welcoming and personable. The hiring process was also smooth. I had a week of training at Beaumont Southfield service center prior to going on site.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time you dealt with a high stress situation

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: the facility in which I interviewed was beautiful and the people were welcoming. The interview process ran smoothly and they asked great interview questions. They also enjoyed my prepared questions as well
Interview Questions: tell us a little about yourself

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: phone interview at first with more basic questions about yourself and the overall job of a nursing assistant, then either a 2nd phone interview or an in-person interview that involves more basic situational questions. Nothing too hard, I wouldn't stress about it, just be yourself and a little prepared!
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Tell me a time you worked with a difficult person.
How do you handle stress?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Super nice and friendly! Asked lots of questions but they just want to get to know you as a person and see if you are the right fit for the job.
Interview Questions: How did you handle your most difficult patient?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was walked through the unit and then we completed the interview portion. It was very easy going, and felt like more of a conversation. It made the process much less nerve wracking
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you experienced conflict and what do you wish you would have done differently

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straightforward, they needed nurses so it was a fairly easy process.  Was basically given the job at the interview.  Manager was kind and I was given a peer interview and a tour of the unit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers are so nice. I can feel that they respect me a lot. Well-organized. They reviewed my resume, made a phone interview with me, then scheduled a team virtual interview. The process was so smooth. Excited to talk with them .
Interview Questions: Describe something about yourself. Why you choose the position

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview, critical thinking questions nothing major. More of get to know you and what you would do in scenarios.  And how you would react to them.  Felt like it was more of getting to know if your easy to work with.
Interview Questions: Dealing with difficult Co workers

title: Summer Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: interviewed by three employees and charge nurses on different floors, then they accepted 50 of 200 acciplants . interview was easy, people were easy to talk to. They did it vitrually over audio with no video.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you managed conflict

title: Emergency Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: Face to face in person for first interview. Over the phone with HR for second interview. Got back to me quickly with a response about whether I was accepted for the job or to move up in the interview process.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy interview was virtual. HR asked a variety of questions or hard at all. I received an offer about a week later telling me I got in. Training provided.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial HR phone interview and then in-person interview with manager on unit. Generic questions about previous work history, overall character, etc. HR was friendly and they got back to me very quickly to offer me the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Beaumont?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with 3 different people. Your first call will be basic question answering and information about the position. The second and third call is after you’ve already accepted the offer and now you have to go through your drug screening and and other pre qualifications.
Interview Questions: How can you benifit the company with your position

title: Clinical Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very respectful, 15 minutes, no curveballs. Super fluid conversations and very humble. Interviewer took a lot of time asking me about my personal view, not just related to easy checkboxes
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Beaumont?

title: Physician Assistant, PA-C Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Classic interview questions with two hiring managers, one of whom is a PA-C. The interview portion lasted about 30 minutes. Then I was given 3 case studies to read through and answer questions about. The case studies were technical and related to the work of the position. Afterward, we discussed my answers. I was then able to shadow a mid level provider for a brief period of time.
Interview Questions: How do you decide how to prioritize your patient load?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Had a brief introductory phone call before advancing to a virtual interview with an HR rep and the superior to the position for which I was applying. Went very well, yet I still had to inquire about update before receiving word.
Interview Questions: Tell us about something you learned in a class of yours that will translate to this role?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Dearborn, MI) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the department manager first. Then, I briefly interviewed with Human Resources over the phone before they offered me the job. It wasn’t too bad. I’ve interviewed at Beaumont twice before. This time definitely went the smoothest.
Interview Questions: Why Beaumont & this job?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and the interviewer was really nice . It was about 45 minutes and questions were straight to the point . I felt like I knew I had the job as soon as I walked out
Interview Questions: How do you work with a team?

title: SLPA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: In person and your of facility . Asked and answered all my questions. Great rapport. Had prepared and unprepared questions asked of me. Overall a very good experience. Staff was helpful and facility was easy to find
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Certified Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy. It took a few weeks for a call back. Then it took about a week to hear back about a job. It was a phone interview.
Interview Questions: What would your last employer say about your attendance?

title: Healthcare Administration Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with current fellows. 3-4 fellows provided a web based interview. Basic questions.  A little stiff feeling, even for an interview. Fellows were open to providing day-to-day experience and job functions.
Interview Questions: Problem solving, personality based questions.

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, after applying online you get a phone interview with HR and then they forward your information to the hiring manager. If they think you're a good fit, you have a in person interview with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How many cases do you have first scrubbing in the operating room

title: Clinical Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview with HR was terrific. The HR consultant was responsive, engaging, and communicative. I enjoyed meeting her. The clinical team interview that followed was the opposite. The lady who would have been my “boss” was very nice and she too was engaging. However, this was the first interview I think I’ve ever had when no one else in the meeting uttered one word. Even when the leader prompted them a couple of times they couldn’t seem to bring themselves to come up with one question for me, thank me for my time, something. It was clear they didn’t want me on the team right away and that was unfortunate. After speaking with HR and the leader of the team (both of whom were very positive and both of whom had access to my CV) I was finally advised that there were concerns about part of my qualifications regarding certain portions the job. I didn’t exactly know how to take that. I am not overly confident or anything like that but I felt confident after both interviews that an offer would be forthcoming so when it wasn’t I was a bit surprised when I didn’t.
Interview Questions: There were a series of the “normal” interview-type questions plus some that were very specific to that particular field of healthcare.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initially there is an interview with HR via the phone. Then they sent my information off to a specific floor for another interview via the phone. Overall pretty easy. They asked about a time when I worked with a difficult coworker.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked with a difficult coworker.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Took the hiring managers a week to schedule my interview and over a month before I heard anything back. The actual interview itself was fair, I just wish they communicated better, didn't ignore my emails, or let me know that I wasn't chosen for the position sooner.
Interview Questions: All situational questions. Ie: Name a time when you *insert clinical scenario*. You had to gives specifics examples of what you DID do, not what you might do.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied to various positions and was emailed by both HR and the nurse manager for a specific unit. Completed two interviews over the phone. HR reviewed by resume and application and asked a few interview questions
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict you experienced

title: Energency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Overall very straightforward, behavioral interview questions.  Hiring manager very welcoming and inviting. Easy with a bit of preparation and some confidence, and there is no pressure during the interview process. Good luck!
Interview Questions: How did you resolve a conflict with peers?

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: interviewed by the manager, assistant manager. But before that i had an interview with unit staff nurses for the floor i applied to. I was basically asked the same questions in both rooms.
Interview Questions: your standard run of the mill scenario and where do you see yourself questions.

title: Clinical Coding Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: One of the best interview experiences I have had. It was straightforward. I received a phone call directly from the hiring manager to set up an interview. After the interview, it took approximately one week for follow up.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: took an online typing test to ensure you can type the basic 55+ wpm...then a medical terminology quiz with basic terms that are easy if you have ever taken an anatomy or physiology course

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with human resources first.
Meeting with floor manager next.  Process was super quick.  Professional interview.  Look forward to joining Beaumont team soon.  Review typical behavior questions.  Overall good experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a conflict with co-worker

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: The process was professional and as would be expected. It takes a little bit of time to get through all of the Human Resources requirements and there are specific orientation dates that have to be scheduled around. Orientation will be full time even for part time or contingent employees so plan accordingly
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses, a time when I could have used better judgement

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health

Interview Questions: why do you think you're a good fit, how did you handle a scenario with a coworker when you didn't agree on a situation, etc.

title: Director of Account Receivables Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Southfield, MI) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very Personal and informative management team question were very appropriate for the the position applied for.  The scenarios used were very intense but helpful to understand the environment an individual would be working with
Interview Questions: As an individual what are your downfalls

title: Graduate Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Human Resources first, going over company questions and preferences and since that went well, interview with unit manager was next. While there, I interviewed with unit manager and assistant manager.

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great interview very professional. The manager was very informal about my position and the change within the company. I like working for this company. Interview Questions: Do I have experience in fast paced environment

title: Data Analyst Interview

Interview Questions: How much experience do you have analyzing data ?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in the department, and it went well. The manager told me they were submitting a job offer. HR called me 3 weeks later and had more questions for me. They had 1 weird question for me and then proceeded to tell me they had an offer.

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Nurse manager was very friendly, welcoming, easy to talk to. Put feedback after each question answered to make you feel more comfortable. The process was smooth. Met with the nurse manager then spoke with HR to finish the process.
Interview Questions: If you had a conflict with your coworker? how would you approach the situation?

title: Ward Secretary Interview

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Farmington Hills, MI) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great staff, very clean and nice. The environment is quiet and calm. Usually fourteen dollars an hour depending on the years of experience. Schedule Is flexible for a full timer I’m not sure about part time though.

title: Entry Level Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Beaumont Health

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview

title: Systems Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with an interview with a staffing company and then one with Beaumont. The interview was simple and straight forward. Normal questions about background and experience in the past.
Interview Questions: N/A

Took about an hour from start to finish upon entering the building.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview

The process was fast and smooth with how they had it set up. I really enjoyed both the people I spoke to and was asked to come in and shadow.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Trenton, MI) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions, phone interview, in person interview with floor/unit manager ,brief meeting with a few of the staff. Process was pretty simple and had a phone call from HR within the next day offering me employment.

title: Medical Scribe Interview

Interview Descriptions: Pretty lengthy interview process. Multiple interviews in a few departments depending on position applying for. One part was with someone in HR and one part was with a corresponding department head.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation in a group when one member isn’t contributing?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Detroit, MI) in Nov 2019

Interview Descriptions: I met with an HR representative first and then with the unit manager where I also got to tour the unit. They asked pretty basic interview questions. Everyone was nice it went smoothly.

Interview Descriptions: I applied online, HR called to schedule a phone interview, had a phone interview with HR representatives, then had an in person interview at HR, interview with unit manager.

title: Business Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: By the book interview. No real personal chat or banter. I couldn’t read the interviewer at all, so wasn’t sure how I did or what she thought of me.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Basically you are spoken to socially with an in-person reading of your resume. Most that have the credential needed and ability to use crayons are hired.  You are a number at this employer and if the need numbers expect a job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had an issue or argument with a co-worker and how was it resolved?

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted for an interview by the placement coordinator within 3 days. The interview was in person, a lot of questions but they weren't that difficult, just basic behaviorals. Also typing test, spelling test, and medical terminology. Spelling was extremely easy, not even medically relevant terms, and terminology was easy as well (multiple choice). I got a call 3 weeks later from HR who asked a couple more behaviorals and then offered me the job at the end. I was surprised that the pay was incredibly low but at that point I had the offer so I took it anyway.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had difficulty with a coworker

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: They ask about customer services. Background. Former jobs. The interviewer was very nice and calm, she explained the job in very description. How the job works and perform and also very appreciated.
Interview Questions: What is one customer satisfaction you would change if you would?

title: Registered Nurse NICU Interview

Interview Descriptions: Applied online, heard back a few weeks after. The interview process was Intimate and relaxed but professional. Was asked some broad nursing questions as well as NICU related. I did not feel intimidated. After I was able to schedule a shadow experience was able to do it just then.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a stressful situation

title: Lab Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied for job on company website. Was called about 3 days after I applied. Interview process consisted of interview with HR rep and manager of department. Typing test was administered. Called references. Offered job and pay.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Taylor, MI) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was brief and to the point, very friendly. The manager asked me questions that were applicable to the unit and made sure to tell me the details of the job and pace of the unit.
Interview Questions: What is something you will bring to this unit?

title: Business Administration Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was a Panel interview with 3 current fellows. It was through skype, and the screen would zoom in on each fellow as questions were asked. It was difficult to focus since the camera would switch so frequently.
Interview Questions: How would you react to a disgruntled patient?

title: IT Architect Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and the recruiter contacted me in a few days for an interview schedule. The interview was good but however, HR Recruiter never responded to any follow-up emails.
Interview Questions: General Technical questions

title: Nursing Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I had one interview and took two days to get the answer . The process was not hard and I had to answer some questions regarding patient care. The unit manager was in the interview as well and asked some questions
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself ?

title: Nursing Care Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: What would I do if a nurse asked me to feed a patient applesauce that had their meds in it?

title: Lab Assistant Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Dearborn, MI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Easy. Informative. Very fast. The recruiter offered me far below a competitive market wage for Registered Nurse ICU. I have many years of experience in the ICU and would be an asset to their system.  The nurse recruiter also became offended when I tried to negotiate for more money and told me I wouldn't get more anywhere else. She could not have been more wrong. I received another offer of  $6.00 more hourly (before shift differential kicks) somewhere else and I accepted that position. I only asked her for a couple dollars more per hour, but no dice.   I last earned what the recruiter offered me seven years ago.  I also have interviewed for jobs at several other healthcare systems and can confidently say that Oakwood/Beaumont is the lowest paid....by a lot.  I have a feeling that Oakwood/Beaumont is probably filled with bedside RNs who have little to no experience due to the low wages. I feel sorry for the patients, because an experienced nurse is an asset to any organization both for mentoring newer nurses and in patient care.  The recruiter told me I should be grateful to be a part of their organization and not surprisingly I was not offered any further interviews due to what I believe was due to me trying to negotiate a competitive wage. My references are excellent, so I know it wasn't the background check(but I don't think it ever reached that point).  Her attitude was "yes we low-balled you, but you should be grateful to have a job because I have 700 other applicants who want to work here."  On the way out, the recruiter told me to check online regarding the status of my application. Haha, that is code for "you are rejected."  

I am comfortably employed and while Oakwood has many other decent attributes and benefits(not the best, but not the worst, I need a fair wage to live on.   I feel like I dodged a bullet and am happy to be an RN that does not have to grovel and accept less than I am worth. I'm looking forward to earning $6.00 more hourly somewhere else. I would bet money that the nurses who say that Oakwood/Beaumont pays well have less than five years experience.  My new job includes full benefits and time off similar to Oakwood. I start next week.  This is Oakwood's loss. I'm positive that many other experienced nurses besides myself with ten plus years have rejected their offer of peanuts for a salary. Oakwood/Beaumont: invest in your nurses and they will invest in you which will lead to less employee turnover which in turn will lower the cost of training all these new grads and inexperienced nurses.

I have learned (the hard way) that employers who are willing to take advantage of good employees financially are willing to take advantage in other ways, i.e. "expand" your job description unofficially or expect you to help out dead weight co-workers sans reward. Skilled employees who benefit their employers have to stand up for themselves and discard the idea that their employer is doing THEM a favor by offering them a job. Healthcare jobs are a dime a dozen. We have a choice of where to work.  This is a case where there are too many administrators which has become a problem in nursing.  Eliminate some of these useless administrative positions and pay the people who are the building blocks of the hospital more.

Paying less than a competitive wage is a red flag for a lack of professionalism in my book.  Oakwood can say it's not all about the money, but isn't money why we all seek jobs.?
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult experience on the job?

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: One interview and meeting with HR and two nurse managers from different units.. I was called 7 days after submitting my application online.  The actual interview took about 25 to 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How would you define excellence

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Trenton, MI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: They were not punctual. I was kept waiting for 20 minutes. Interview was average time. I felt as if the person interviewing me did not want to be there. She seemed distracted, and like she had do be somewhere else. I was hoping to see the unit I would be working on, but I did not receive a tour. It would have been good to see how it operates. I am still waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: Describe a typical work day

title: Dietetic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: The application is through a third party site (DICAS). Once that application is submitted, Beaumont screens the applicants and may contact you for an interview. The interview is on skype, which was convenient for me since I was away at school, but it is an intimidating setting. There were five or six interviewers, the questions were read off a list that they must have all had in front of them. With it being on skype, it was hard to read their reactions/expressions to your answers or if they were looking for more or less.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you bent or broke the rules.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with manager and two project managers prior to HR interview.  Standard questions.  Took about a week to get an offer.  Was able to negotiate a bit
Interview Questions: Had I ever worked with Physicians before

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had one round of interviews with 2 individuals and overall I felt that the interview went well.  Yet, I felt that there may of been some discrimination in terms of age because I internally felt and can not prove this case since many of  the employees were younger than myself and I felt that is what they were looking for individuals below the age of 35.  I also did not ever receive a curtesy email to follow up.  I have grave concerns regarding this type of hiring practices of age discrimination with Beaumont.
Interview Questions: What kids of experience do you have with autism?  Are you willing to drive to other facilities?

title: Cardiovascular Medical Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Grosse Pointe, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Interview took less than an hour. Generic interview questions. Interviewer was friendly and comforting. There was an arrhythmia test at the end of the interview and a tour of the cardiac wing.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied in the beginning of the month for one position and received a call for a panel interview for the floor I applied for and for another similar floor.  My interview was set for the following week.  The week after I received a call and was offered a part-time position for both floors.  I was given the weekend to think about it.
Interview Questions: What are three qualities you believe everyone needs to have in order to work?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty straight forward. You interview with interviewer from the HR department, and then you go interview the head nurse and nurse Assistant on the unit you applied for. With HR, they go over your application with you, ask you questions about it and of course other common interview questions. .....with the nurse and na they ask you questions from a nurse Assistant point of  view.
Interview Questions: What so something about you that you're working on?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: First, you interview with HR department and they ask you a set of questions to see if you would qualify for a interview with the nurse manager. Then I had an interview with unit manager and received a tour of the unit
Interview Questions: Name a time you created a good customer experience for a patient

title: Tech Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is quite basic. Nothing out of the ordinary. It helps to have somewhat of a background in the medical field and sometimes even acknowledging that you are actively pursuing a career as a future RN or something hospital related. Other than that it's just the average questions you'd get asks at any other interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you think your current qualities make you suitable for this job?

title: Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Short, friendly, asked where I wanted to be in ten years, I said right here!  I took a coding test & got hired.  I had a great orientation & plenty of time to get comfortable & get up to speed. I did not apply online (this was back in the late 90s!) I sent in a paper resume in the mail & got a phone call.  Next thing I knew I was hired.  I actually worked there from about 1996 or 1997 til 2000 when I quit to get married & moved to Florida.  Every time I was in town for a few weeks they called me & asked me to work as many hours as I wanted at top pay & no evaluations or testing.  Wish I was still there!
Interview Questions: where I wanted to be in ten years

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then Human Resources called by phone to schedule an interview. Interview went smoothly. no unusual questions. Friendly atmosphere. After a week or so, they called again to offer the job, and I accepted their offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very professional. It wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. The women in HR who interviewed me was so sweet.. She made me feel comfortable. I studied all night long on interview questions just to be prepared. Just go in and be yourself.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you and a co-worker couldn't see eye to eye

title: Entrance Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First Interview with HR and 2nd interview with Assistant Director and the 3rd interview with the Director (Little bit rude). nice people and nice environment. Hope this is helpful.
1. Good Pay - AB 7
2. Hrd Job - Asked why i'm interested
Interview Questions: Work related

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very vague, only 1 round. Interviewers dont really know what they are asking, they are more looking for a personality, rather than a skill set. The interviewing will be followed by the HR, where you will basically negotiate the benefits.
Interview Questions: Tell us something about yourself, what do you know about health care.

title: Radiology Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Radiology managers at the West Bloomfield location. They both were very nice and friendly. Asked general questions, such as work history, qualifications for the job, importance of team work, and what I would bring to the table.They informed me that I would have to met with a HR representative at the Royal Oak campus the following week for a second interview. The following Monday, I met with this rude woman who seemed nice at first, but was short with me and seemed unimpressed with me. I would try to answer her questions but she would respond with smart remarks. She also asked questions that were irrelevant to the job itself and was extremely nosy. They never informed me if I got the job or not, but I'm certain that I didn't.
Interview Questions: What would you sacrifice in order to do the job your loved?

title: Clinical Assistant II/Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with employees in department. It was casual yet, they asked difficult questions. Interview/hiring process is very lengthy. This is a great company to work for. Great room for advancement and benefits.
Interview Questions: Why healthcare?

title: Patient Transport Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: First you go in and have an interview with someone in HR. They'll go over every page of your application, and I was asked quite a lot of questions. Depending on how well your interview went with that person, they;ll send you down to meet with the head of transport where you'll have your second interview. They pretty much ask the same questions. They're super nice!
Interview Questions: What was one of your most difficult situations you&amp;#039;ve had at work and how did you handle it?

title: Physician's Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Typing test and spelling test, afterwards i scheduled an appointment for an interview. the process took a few weeks. I was interviewed by two groups of people. One interview just talked about the position, while the other one had asked behavioral questions
Interview Questions: How do you place your priorities

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Taylor, MI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, typical interview questions were Asked, there were multiple steps involved in the interview. Started with a phone screen and then interviews with managers and HR. There was also a peer to peer interview.
Interview Questions: What is one time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Rehab Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two supervisors. Very basic questions. Went over classes I've took. They responded within a couple days. I explained that I had a lot to offer and would love the opportunity to learn from the department.
Interview Questions: What was a hard situation and how did you adapt?

title: Patient Assistant- Sitter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got the call a couple months after I applied to schedule an interview. The interview was fairly easy I spoke with my HR rep and she asked straight forward questions. Once that was over she had me talk to the department manager. I got a call back a week after offering my the job.
Interview Questions: What did you do when you experienced a conflict with a coworker?

title: Research Services Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Southfield, MI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed first with the supervisor and then HR. It was an easy process and they asked the typical interview questions. Both the supervisor and HR person were very nice. The interview with the supervisor was very informal. I thought it was a bit weird to interview with supervisor and then HR, but in the end it worked out and i was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Questions were straight forward and related the the position. All the people in the human resources were very nice. I applied online. Took about a week to call back. Filled out some paper work, took a typing, spelling, and medical terminology test, interviewed with HR, and then one other person.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Initially met with unit manager and the interview mainly consisted of questions regarding behavioral analysis. Needed to have examples of several different types of conflict and how I reacted in those situations. Second interview is with HR and the questions were more related to past work experience and functioning as a nurse as well as going over your references and certifications.
Interview Questions: Name two traits of your best friend that you don't possess, but wish that you did?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was ok for the job the I was applying for. I was a little nervous but the person that interviewed me made me more comfortable. The interviewer wanted to know how interested I was for the job I applied to and why.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to provide the job functions that are asked of you.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call from the manager on the floor about a week later. I interviewed with the manager and then interviewed with a charge nurse and NA on the floor. A day later HR called and I interviewed with them.
Interview Questions: They ask a lot of teamwork and "what would you do in this situation" questions. You also want to have specific reasons for why you want to work at Beaumont

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR for a floor interview. Interviewed the next day. Very informal and laid back. Maybe it was chemistry, or a laid back management all together. Received a call 2 days later (On a Saturday) for a HR interview. Interviewed that Monday. Less laid back, but seems as though it went well. A week later I received the offer.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were frustrated with a patient or family

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very intense with HR with over fifteen questions being asked, before interviewing with the supervisor of the department.  Both interviewers were very nice and professional.  Beaumont Hospital is a straight-shooter when it comes to interviews.  If they are not interested you will know immediately.  The interview/hiring process is quite lengthy due to the scheduling of the physical exam, etc. I would say about a month is average which includes interviewing, physical exam, etc.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a co-worker who is not a team player, but requires two disciplines to treat the patient effectively and safely.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 2 associate managers from the unit and then with the Nurse Recruiter. All questions were read off of a form and did not allow for much discussion. The interview lasted around 40 minutes and the interviewers were all very nice and cordial.
Interview Questions: Give a specific example of a time you worked as a team member.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It took months before my app was acknowledged. The first interview was with the HR rep, then the same day my second interview was with the Nursing Manager. It took them a month to give me a decision.
Interview Questions:
what was my major?
why I wanted to work for them
previous work experience

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with manager of unit, very professional, was given a tour of unit. The manger talked about the unit, how things were handled. Was able to have a peer sit down as well to better understand the future co workers. Was able to shadow for a little bit before accepting the job. overall very helpful and informative.
Interview Questions: How can you handle a difficult patient professionally?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Filled out application online, was called two days later for an interview.  The interviewers were very nice, but I felt like every time I answered a question they had to glance at each other,  It made me uncomfortable.  I think it was a good thing that they didn't offer me the job because I don't think I could have worked for someone that made me so uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time when your integrity was questioned and what was the outcome, I told them I couldn't recall a time when my integrity was every in question (I still can't ever think of a time) and they didn't seem to like that,

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The pre interview is very strict. You have to answer a bunch of medical terminology questions, take a spelling quiz, and a typing test. The spelling test was I think 25 words and either you checked it if was spelled wrong or left it if it wasn't. The words had nothing to do with medicine or a hospital.
Interview Questions: The hardest part for me was the typing test. I was one word per minute short of the requirement and was told I couldn't continue. I have to go back in two weeks to try again.

title: Resident Physician/Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I did my externship there and so I was told about the job by the manager and then I interviewed with her at the hospital and then there was another interview in the HR department in Southfield.  The interviewer was very friendly.  It took about two hours from the time I got there to the time I left.  After I left it took about 3 days to hear from them with an offer.  When I accepted they sent a hiring packet in the mail with a few papers to fill out and the information about benefits.  I also received three emails about setting up my password and what steps to follow to fill out some online paperwork.  Then I went to get my drug test, TB test and blood test for my titers.  Waited for the results Called HR and will bring the paperwork to them and then do an orientation and start work after that.
Interview Questions: She was very interested in team player questions.  Like, when did you have to deal with a conflict in a group setting and how did you deal with it?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: They asked many questions about different situations. They were thorough on working with others and looked for a lot of maturity in your answers. They want experience, but they can see through a robotic answer. They want you to be yourself.
Interview Questions: How do you work with others?

title: Education Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty traditional question and answer.. After the interview, it can take up to 6 months before you start. Make sure you send a card after interview, my card is what got me the job.
Interview Questions: One of the questions I had trouble coming up with an immediate response was, tell me the most creative thing you've done lately

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: One interview and meeting with HR
Interview Questions: Mostly personality questions -- nothing clinical

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were three different floor managers that were in the room interviewing me. They asked a lot of behavioral questions. As nervous as I was and answering intense questions the managers were really nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time where you came up with an idea to solve a problem at work.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: After applying at Beaumonts online career site, I was contacted for an interview. The office manager was very pleasant and thorough, even introduced me to all staff and a few doctors in the office. My overall view of the interview process is positive, both the office manager and staff were friendly and inviting. It would be a privilege to be a part of that team. I am currently awaiting a response for the available position.
Interview Questions: What was your most uncomfortable situation you experienced while working, and how did u handle it.

title: Ward Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough and fair though they could've explained a bit better during hiring as opting into insurance benefits was not clear; simple questions and answers; wpm test administered during second round of interview process
Interview Questions: a word per minute exam is administered

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: I had three total interview and a lot of back and forth communication to address further questions. I was contacted by manager and brought in for an interview with her (usually you go through HR first). I then had my HR interview and finally an interview with the staff. The whole process was fairly drawn out.
Interview Questions: Most questions related to my previous work processes and accomplishments. A few behavior questions.

title: Physical Therapist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, straight forward process.  I applied, the called a week later and immediately interviewed.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected.

title: Telemetry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health
Interview Descriptions: I had 1 interviews. There is first a somewhat challenging EKG test prior to the 1st interview that you must pass to continue on to the interview. The interview was a mix of casual/professional. Nothing super worrisome.
Interview Questions: Study your AFibs and AV blocks. Otherwise the questioning during the interview wasn't anything to worry about.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process is lengthy, usually about a month. HR takes a while to clear you for work. Drug testing required, usually a phone interview then an in person interview. Usually you will meet with HR first and interview with them, if you pass their interview screen, they will set you up with an interview with the department manager you will be working for. Your manager may choose to have the assistant manager sit in on your interview as well.
Interview Questions: Give to situations in which you have gone above and beyond for your patient,

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Easy resume talk through.  Very relazed
Interview Questions: Tell me about a staff conflict you had and how you dealt with it.  Difficult to answer, as I had never experienced it before.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was rushed. I was interrogated by three people who shot questions at me from all directions.  They read from a prepared booklet.  I felt I had to answer quickly and was not asked any questions about me,  just examples of experience and it was quick-quick-quick!  I don't feel I received any respect as to who I was or how I would fit into their position.
Interview Questions: why do you want this job? asked as they were getting up to leave. no time to answer other than...,

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Grosse Pointe, MI) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had interview with the HR department in St. Clair Shores and then on the floor at the Hospital.  Met with the Assistant Nurse Manager of the floor and had basic behavioral/personal questions similar to HR and then some situational.
Interview Questions: What would you say are your three best qualities

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Casual, met with director and it was obvious from the moment the interview started that they were just going through formalities and had already chosen someone for the job
Interview Questions: There weren't any focused questions or difficult questions. In fact, the interview was not focused at all.

title: Physician's Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phone for an interview after an application was submitted online.  They got back to me promptly and arranged for an interview through HR.  Interview was very informal and laid back.  The interviewer was interactive and warm.  Beaumont immediately stresses how important their "Beaumont Standards" are and how you would fit into their environment, how you deal with stress, how you deal with unsatisfied patients, etc.
Interview Questions:
What are your biggest strengths / what are your biggest weaknesses? 
How do you deal with stressful situations?

title: Trauma Surgery PA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial contacts with HR.  Sometimes quite a delay before scheduling an interview and when making an offer.  Interview same day with HR and hiring manager.  Pretty smooth, low stress interviews.
Interview Questions: "How would your classmates describe you?"  "Tell me three words that describe you."

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with an HR employee. The questions were straight forward tell me about a time when..., what I like best about scribing, all relevant questions. Second interview was with the chief scribe and chief physician of the EC. Similar questions to HR. Everyone was pretty nice.
Interview Questions: There were no odd ball questions. everything was straight forward and relevant to the job and my experience. Had to take a spelling test, medical terminology test, and typing test.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had a single interview with a Human Resources staff (single person);  I received a phone call from HR to follow-up after single interview and offer me the job about 1-2 weeks after interview.  The salary was offered at the follow-up phone call.    I attended a week-long orientation program prior to hire; Nothing difficult at the interview, no testing;
Interview Questions: Can't recall but nothing difficult

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, group interview, and then placed into a position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Dearborn, MI) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It took a long time around 4 months to get a call back. When I did get my interview it did not last long they have a warm bodies theory for employment. Pay close attention to all orientation activities I almost got fired for rescheduling part of it.
Interview Questions: What are the baselines for vitals?

title: Financial Analyst I Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Great company to interview with.  Very in depth questions and wanted to know a lot about previous employment.  Nice workplace and very respectable employees. They have lots of "entry level" positions open but as far as senior positions or experienced professional positions there were none at the time of me applying.
Interview Questions: Name a challenging time you had with your supervisor / boss and how did you solve it?

title: Customer Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication with the company was positive.  Interview consisted of "behavioral" qustions about customer service, listening skills, etc.  The job posting listed a Bachelors degree as a requirement, but the pay scale was extremely low even for a entry-level position.  No benefits and full-time.  The "title" for this job did meet what was required for the job... it seemed to keep from paying out a lower rate.  Unsure about hours, stating they change on a daily basis.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you provided excellent customer service.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The atmosphere is casual. Interviewers are easy going and honest. They easy to talk to and give tours of the department to all applicants.
Interview Questions: Answering questions about past job. Their dislikes and future goals.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Team interview with canned questions read from a page, each person took turns asking questions. They wrote very brief notes on my responses, but otherwise didn't seem particularly engaged or even interested.
Interview Questions: Typical: "Can you recall a time when you had a disagreement with a coworker? How did you handle it?"

title: Accounts Receivable Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Troy, MI) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very short with standard questions. Needed to know I knew how to use a computer, excel, word, etc. I was also shown other employees desks and how the work was done.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Face to Face interview Followed by a clinic visit for TB testing and physical
Interview Questions: Very basic interview Process to determine your level of excellence and dedication to your team and patient care.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the unit manager first, where I was asked questions about my experience, what I wanted from the job, and the typical personality-type questions.  I then interviewed with the HR representative, whom asked me similar personality-type questions.  I was explained in detail the job description, benefits package, and salary.  It was all professionally done and well very well.  I heard back within a week.
Interview Questions: The questions were typical personality-based questions, and the question I usually have a hard time with is "what are your weaknesses?"  It is hard to determine what type of answer they will like, that does not sound negative or something too corny.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Standard for RN interview
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: received a call from HR. Made appointment to meet with HR for interview. Completed HR interview and psychological exam. Received follow up call to schedule interview with department. Interviewed with department. Received phone call to be offered position and scheduled a meeting with HR to complete paperwork for accepted position. Completed drug screen and physical. Scheduled and completed hospital orientation. Meet with Educational coordinator and set up unit orientation and completed mandatory education online. Started and completed orientation to unit.
Interview Questions: None really come to mind. I was prepared for the interview and the types of questions asked.

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beaumont Health (Royal Oak, MI) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions:
Their online application process was a snap.  Very easy.  I ended up going to 3 separate interviews.   I was sent an e-mail from an Admin. Assistant in IT requesting a time to interview with an Assistant Director in IT.  
About 1-2 weeks later, I interviewed with 2 Project Managers on the team I'd be working on.  The process seems to slow down in HR.  It was a number of weeks before I was finally contacted by HR personnel, and I'm pretty sure they already had full contact information of 3 manager-level and higher references.  They request that you bring in original versions of all of your degrees and certificates (hint:  you can leave them in the frames - they take photo copies of them and give them right back to you).  While in the HR office, I also met with the HR Rep.  If I recall correctly, she already contacted my references and I thought she was going to make an offer to me on that visit.  To my dismay, she did not.  I can't recall how soon after an offer was made but I received a phone call, an e-mail, and a written letter with an offer eventually.
Interview Questions: Describe a most favorite boss and why was he or she your favorite boss.
